en.content: Let $f(x)+2 f\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)=x^2+5$ and $2 g(x)-3 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)=x, x>0$. If $\alpha=\int_1^2 f(x) \mathrm{d} x$, and $\beta=\int_1^2 g(x) \mathrm{d} x$, then the value of $9 \alpha+\beta$ is :
en.explanation:
$$\begin{aligned} & f(x)+2 f\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)=x^2+5 \\ & 2 f\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)+4 f(x)=2\left(\frac{1}{x^2}+5\right) \\ & 3 f(x)=\frac{2}{x^2}-x^2+5 \\ & f(x)=\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{2}{x^2}-x^2+5\right) \\ & 2 g(x)-3 g\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)=x \\ & 2 g\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)-3 g(x)=\frac{1}{x} \\ & \text { Or } 4 g(x)-6 g\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)=2 x \\ & 6 g\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)-9 g(x)=\frac{3}{x} \\ & -5 g(x)=2 x+\frac{3}{x} \end{aligned}$$

$$ \begin{aligned} & \text { Or } g(x)=-\frac{1}{5}\left(2 x+\frac{3}{x}\right) \\ & \int_1^2 f(x) d x=\int_1^2 \frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{2}{x^2}-x^2+5\right) d x \end{aligned}$$

$$ \begin{aligned} &\begin{aligned} & =\frac{1}{3}\left[-\frac{2}{x}-\frac{x^3}{3}+5 x\right]_1^2 \\ & =\frac{1}{3}\left[\left(-\frac{2}{2}-\frac{8}{3}+10\right)-\left(-2-\frac{1}{3}+5\right)\right] \\ & =\frac{1}{3}\left[-1-\frac{8}{3}+10+2+\frac{1}{3}-5\right] \\ & \alpha=\frac{11}{9} \end{aligned}\\ &\text { Now, } 2 g(x)=x+3 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)\\ &\begin{aligned} & 2 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)=\frac{1}{2}+3 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right) \\ & g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)=-\frac{1}{2} \end{aligned} \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & \therefore \beta=\int_1^2 g(x) d x \\ & =\frac{1}{2} \int_1^2\left(x+3 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)\right) d x \\ & =\frac{1}{2}\left[\frac{x^2}{2}+3 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right) x\right]_1^2 \\ & =0 \\ & \therefore 9 \alpha+\beta=11 \end{aligned}$$

hi.content: माना $f(x)+2 f\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)=x^2+5$ और $2 g(x)-3 g\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)=x, x>0$ हैं। यदि $\alpha=\int_1^2 f(x) \mathrm{d} x$, और $\beta=\int_1^2 g(x) \mathrm{d} x$ हैं, तो $9 \alpha+\beta$ का मान है :
hi.explanation:
$$\begin{aligned} & f(x)+2\,f\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x}\bigr)=x^2+5 \\ & 2\,f\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x}\bigr)+4\,f(x)=2\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x^2}+5\bigr) \\ & 3\,f(x)=\tfrac{2}{x^2}-x^2+5 \\ & f(x)=\tfrac{1}{3}\bigl(\tfrac{2}{x^2}-x^2+5\bigr) \\ & 2\,g(x)-3\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x}\bigr)=x \\ & 2\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x}\bigr)-3\,g(x)=\tfrac{1}{x} \\ & \text{या }\,4\,g(x)-6\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x}\bigr)=2x \\ & 6\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{x}\bigr)-9\,g(x)=\tfrac{3}{x} \\ & -5\,g(x)=2x+\tfrac{3}{x} \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & \text{या }\,g(x)=-\tfrac{1}{5}\bigl(2x+\tfrac{3}{x}\bigr) \\ & \int_1^2 f(x)\,d x = \int_1^2 \tfrac{1}{3}\bigl(\tfrac{2}{x^2}-x^2+5\bigr)\,d x \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & \begin{aligned} & =\tfrac{1}{3}\bigl[-\tfrac{2}{x}-\tfrac{x^3}{3}+5x\bigr]_1^2 \\ & =\tfrac{1}{3}\bigl[(-\tfrac{2}{2}-\tfrac{8}{3}+10)-(-2-\tfrac{1}{3}+5)\bigr] \\ & =\tfrac{1}{3}\bigl[-1-\tfrac{8}{3}+10+2+\tfrac{1}{3}-5\bigr] \\ & \alpha=\tfrac{11}{9} \end{aligned}\\ & \text{अब, } 2\,g(x)=x+3\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{2}\bigr)\\ & \begin{aligned} & 2\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{2}\bigr)=\tfrac{1}{2}+3\,g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{2}\bigr) \\ & g\bigl(\tfrac{1}{2}\bigr)=-\tfrac{1}{2} \end{aligned} \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & \therefore \beta=\int_1^2 g(x)\,d x \\ & =\tfrac{1}{2}\int_1^2\bigl(x+3\,g(\tfrac{1}{2})\bigr)\,d x \\ & =\tfrac{1}{2}\bigl[\tfrac{x^2}{2}+3\,g(\tfrac{1}{2})\,x\bigr]_1^2 \\ & =0 \\ & \therefore 9\,\alpha+\beta=11 \end{aligned}$$

en.content: The value of $\int_\limits{-1}^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^x+(\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}} d x$ is equal to
en.explanation:
$$\begin{aligned} & I=\int_{-1}^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^x+(\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}} d x \\ & =\int_0^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^x+(\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}} \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & +\left(\frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|+x}) e^{-x}+(\sqrt{|x|+x}) e^{-x}}{e^{-x}+e^x}\right) d x \\ = & \int_0^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}+\sqrt{|x|+x})\left(e^x+e^{-x}\right)}{e^x+e^{-x}} d x \\ = & \int_0^1(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}+\sqrt{|x|+x}) d x \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & =\int_0^1(1+\sqrt{2 x}) d x=\left.x\right|_0 ^1+\left.\frac{\sqrt{2} x^{\frac{3}{2}}}{\frac{3}{2}}\right|_0 ^1 \\ & =1+\frac{2 \sqrt{2}}{3} \end{aligned}$$

hi.content: $\int_{-1}^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^x+(\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}} d x$ का मान है
hi.explanation:
$$\begin{aligned} & I=\int_{-1}^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^x+(\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}} \, d x \\ & =\int_0^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^x+(\sqrt{|x|-x}) e^{-x}}{e^x+e^{-x}} \, d x \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & +\left(\frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|+x}) e^{-x}+(\sqrt{|x|+x}) e^{-x}}{e^{-x}+e^x}\right) d x \\ = & \int_0^1 \frac{(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}+\sqrt{|x|+x})\left(e^x+e^{-x}\right)}{e^x+e^{-x}} \, d x \\ = & \int_0^1(1+\sqrt{|x|-x}+\sqrt{|x|+x}) \, d x \end{aligned}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & =\int_0^1(1+\sqrt{2 x}) \, d x=\left.x\right|_0 ^1+\left.\frac{\sqrt{2} x^{\frac{3}{2}}}{\frac{3}{2}}\right|_0 ^1 \\ & =1+\frac{2 \sqrt{2}}{3} \end{aligned}$$

en.content: The integral $\int_0^\pi \frac{8 x d x}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x}$ is equal to
en.explanation:
$$\begin{aligned} & I=\int_0^\pi \frac{8 x}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x} d x \ldots(1) \\ & I=\int_0^\pi \frac{8(\pi-x)}{4 \cos ^2(\pi-x)+\sin ^2(\pi-x)} d x \\ & I=\int_0^\pi \frac{8(\pi-x)}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x} d x \ldots(2) \end{aligned}$$

Adding (1) and (2)

$$\begin{aligned} & 2 I=8 \pi \int_0^\pi \frac{1}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x} d x \\ & I=4 \pi \times 2 \int_0^\pi \frac{\sec ^2 x}{4 \tan ^2 x} d x \end{aligned}$$

Put $\tan x=t$

$$\sec ^2 x d x=d t$$

$$I=8 \pi \int_0^{\infty} \frac{d t}{4+t^2}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & I=8 \pi \frac{1}{2}\left(\tan ^{-1} \frac{t}{2}\right)_0^{\infty} \\ & I=4 \pi\left(\frac{\pi}{2}\right) \\ & I=2 \pi^2 \end{aligned}$$

hi.content: समाकलन $\int_0^\pi \frac{8 x d x}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x}$ बराबर है
hi.explanation:
$$\begin{aligned} & I=\int_0^\pi \frac{8 x}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x} \, d x \ldots(1) \\ & I=\int_0^\pi \frac{8(\pi-x)}{4 \cos ^2(\pi-x)+\sin ^2(\pi-x)} \, d x \\ & I=\int_0^\pi \frac{8(\pi-x)}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x} \, d x \ldots(2) \end{aligned}$$

(1) और (2) को जोड़कर

$$\begin{aligned} & 2 I=8 \pi \int_0^\pi \frac{1}{4 \cos ^2 x+\sin ^2 x} \, d x \\ & I=4 \pi \times 2 \int_0^\pi \frac{\sec ^2 x}{4 \tan ^2 x} \, d x \end{aligned}$$

मान लीजिए $\tan x=t$

$$\sec^2 x \, d x=d t$$

$$I=8 \pi \int_0^{\infty} \frac{d t}{4+t^2}$$

$$\begin{aligned} & I=8 \pi \frac{1}{2}\bigl(\tan^{-1}\frac{t}{2}\bigr)_0^{\infty} \\ & I=4 \pi\bigl(\frac{\pi}{2}\bigr) \\ & I=2 \pi^2 \end{aligned}$$
